This is the human cost of our profit-driven health care system.

Instead of focusing on getting better, Americans diagnosed with cancer have to battle their insurance companies.

This is the needless cruelty we will end with Medicare for All.https://twitter.com/RoKhanna/status/1186005155092799488 …

I stand with @CTULocal1 members at Passages Charter School in Chicago who are on strike today for their students alongside the tens of thousands of CTU and @SEIU73 members. What's happening in Chicago is the kind of movement we need to win justice for working people everywhere.https://twitter.com/iftaft/status/1186652055672426497 …

I stand with @32BJSEIU airport workers at Eulen America who are taking a stand against unpaid wages and health and safety violations. Eulen must respect its workers and their right to organize without fear or intimidation.https://twitter.com/FlyingWithSara/status/1186373833160310784 …
Tulsi Gabbard has put her life on the line to defend this country. People can disagree on issues, but it is outrageous for anyone to suggest that Tulsi is a foreign asset.

Imagine going to the hospital, getting treatment you need and never getting a bill for it or having to pay an insurance premium.

You just imagined every major country except the United States.

We are going to pass Medicare for All and make that a reality in America.

We will not stand idly by and allow three people in this country to own more wealth than the bottom half of America, while at the same time, nearly 20% of our children live in poverty, veterans sleep out on the streets and seniors cannot afford their prescription drugs.

In a city struggling with homelessness, Amazon is dropping an outrageous amount of money to defeat progressive candidates fighting for working people.

The way Amazon conducts itself in its hometown is a perfect example of the out-of-control corporate greed we are going to end.https://twitter.com/thenation/status/1184794855375015941 …

Our grassroots-funded campaign is proving every single day that you don't need billionaires and private fundraisers to run for president.
Not only are we going to defeat Trump, we're going to make him pay an additional $142 million with our tax on extreme wealth.
When we win the Democratic nomination and defeat Donald Trump, we will transform our political system by rejecting the influence of big corporate money.

Money is not speech.

Corporations are not people. 

And you shouldn't have to beg the rich and powerful for money to run for office. 

Today we are releasing our plan to get corporate money out of politics.https://berniesanders.com/issues/money-out-of-politics/ …
Passing Medicare for All and eliminating all past-due medical debt is not only our moral obligation. It is economically necessary.https://twitter.com/business/status/1178776326892859394 …

Trump's vision of government is one that serves the rich and attacks the poor. We have a different idea. We are going to protect the programs that are life-and-death for millions of working people and make the wealthy pay their fair share.https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1180214778477907971 …
Maybe I'm old fashioned. But I believe we should have a president who believes in the United States Constitution.

We set an ambitious goal: 1,000,000 calls to early states in 10 days. It took our volunteers just nine.

When politicians like Trump say we must cut food stamps, Medicaid and public housing, it's not because we don't have the money.

We're the richest country on Earth!

It's because they refuse to stand up to their billionaire donors, who hoard wealth and stash it in tax havens.
No person needs to have tens of billions of dollars while others sleep out on the streets. We're going to tax the ultra rich and use the revenue to guarantee decent housing for all.

Mental health care shouldn't be a privilege for the wealthy. It should be accessible to all. Medicare for All will guarantee mental health coverage to every person in this country, free at the point of service. #WorldMentalHealthDay

It's not coincidental that the top health care CEOs made $1.1 billion last year while 4 in 10 cancer patients lose their life savings due to treatment.

Our system is designed to take money from sick people and put it in the pockets of rich executives.

We need Medicare for All.

Let me congratulate the @massaflcio on their support for Medicare for All. When every American has comprehensive health care as a right, unions will no longer have to spend enormous amounts of time and energy fighting to maintain their employer-based health insurance benefits.https://twitter.com/theintercept/status/1182057953328816133 …

Irresponsible corporate greed threatened the health and safety of 800,000 Californians. Meanwhile, PG&E has paid out billions to its shareholders. Thank you Detroit and Rep. @RashidaTlaib! Our message to the top 1% and powerful corporations: this nation belongs to all of us, not just the few. Can you hear us now?pic.twitter.com/TvvHizsJGU

Don't let anyone tell you that our vision is radical or extreme. Radical and extreme is giving a trillion dollars in tax breaks to the top 1% when half a million Americans will be homeless tonight. That's radical.
Don't believe anyone who tells you that moving toward a society of justice is impossible.

If there ever was a time for millions of people to come together and build a mass movement for justice, now is that time. Join us live from Detroit at our rally with @RashidaTlaib, Jack White, and more:https://www.pscp.tv/w/cIYE_zMyNzU3OTl8MXJteFBYYmJrRVF4Tmq1e0SG6vler444g41c3G_nM9In1kAEpHsCl18TtD3s …

Today marks one year since the massacre at the Tree of Life synagogue, the deadliest anti-Semitic attack in U.S. history. We mourn for the eleven victims, and we remain committed to fighting white supremacist violence as the national security threat that it is.
Our hearts go out to Californians affected by the devastating wildfires. Climate change is real, and when I am president, we are going to treat this like the existential crisis it is.

Tonight: join me and @RashidaTlaib for a rally featuring live performances by Jack White and the Cass Tech Madrigals! Watch live at http://live.berniesanders.com .

The primary goal of a criminal justice system should not be punishment, but whenever possible, rehabilitation.

Today marks 18 years since the U.S. invaded Afghanistan.

There are now soldiers old enough to deploy who were born after September 11th. We should honor their courage and patriotism by putting an end to endless war.https://twitter.com/ABC/status/1181206375503994881 …

This president’s shameful decision on Syria is the latest example of chaos masquerading as foreign policy. It goes against all military advice. It harms our national interests, emboldens our adversaries, and it will cost lives. The world urgently needs real American leadership.
Joshua Brown showed us what real courage looks like. Now we must show him and his family what real justice looks like. His murder must be investigated. We deserve answers.

Today would have been Fannie Lou Hamer's 102nd birthday. We must honor her legacy by fighting to end suppression—by breaking down the barriers that make it harder for Black Americans to vote. As president, I will do everything in my power to protect that fundamental right.

From securing additional funding for schools to effectively combating New Hampshire’s substance use disorder crisis, Mayor Craig has addressed Manchester’s challenges head-on. There is no such thing as a permanently red state. Thank you to every organizer and supporter whose acts of hope made last night possible. You helped to elect @AndyBeshearKY in Kentucky and flip the Virginia legislature. Congratulations to Democrats across the country!

Big congratulations to James @MuellerforMayor and all of the South Bend Common Council members elected tonight! Great opportunities are ahead for continued progress and inclusive growth in our hometown.

Climate catastrophe is on the horizon—whether this president believes it or not. As president, I will restore American credibility and leadership by rejoining the #ParisAgreement and engaging the world to tackle climate as the global security issue of our time. We can’t wait.

This week marks the anniversaries of three of the deadliest mass shootings in American history: Fort Hood and Sutherland Springs, Texas; and Thousand Oaks, California.

Our calendars are filling up with reminders of Washington’s failure to keep us safe. It’s time for change.

Take it from me: state and local elections matter.

I just voted here in South Bend. If you're in Indiana, Kentucky, Mississippi, New Hampshire, or Virginia, please get out there and vote. Click below to find a polling location near you.http://IWillVote.com

Don’t wait until next year’s presidential election to make your voice heard. Tomorrow, important state and local elections are happening across the country. Learn more—especially if you’re in IN, KY, MS, NH, or VA—and make a plan to vote. http://IWillVote.com

Two of my three brothers are Republicans, but there are core things we are fighting for together. People across the country are ready for an America that works for everyone. 2020 is our moment is history. I know what’s broken, and I know how to fix it. #DemDebate

The @CFPB was an example of dreaming big and fighting hard. People told me, go for something little. Go for something that the big corporations will be able to accept. I said no. Let's go for an agency that will make big, structural change in our economy. #DemDebate

After the financial crisis, I had an idea for a consumer agency that would stop banks from cheating people. Republicans, big banks, even Democrats told me: You’ll never get it passed. But I fought hard. To date, the @CFPB has returned $12 billion to American consumers. #DemDebate

We need to address the elephant in the room: How campaigns are financed. Today, I announced that I’m not taking any money from Big Pharma, Big Tech, or Wall Street executives. You can’t go behind closed doors, take their money and then expect them to enforce the rules. #DemDebate

I’m not willing to give up and let a handful of monopolies dominate our economy and our democracy. You get to be the umpire in the baseball game or you get to be a team—but you can’t be both. It’s time to #BreakUpBigTech. #DemDebatehttps://elizabethwarren.com/plans/break-up-big-tech …

I will outwork, out-organize, and outlast anyone—and that means Donald Trump, Mike Pence, or whoever the Republicans get stuck with. We can’t nibble around the edges. Democrats win when we call out what’s broken, and when we give people a reason to get in the fight. #DemDebate

 $800 billion dollars into our public schools

Murder is the third leading cause of death for Native women & girls. This is an epidemic.

I released a plan today that will fight to open federal databases to Indian Country. We must get to the bottom of the staggering number of missing, murdered, & trafficked Indigenous women.

The United States has signed over 500 treaties with Tribal Nations—and we have broken every single one of them.

Because of our actions, Native American communities lag behind others in terms of health care, education, and economic development. Together, we can right this.https://twitter.com/tperry518/status/1186260709702848513 …

It’s past time our nation invested in Native American communities. Here’s what I’ll do as president:
→Honor tribal sovereignty and restore tribal lands
→Fight the staggering epidemic of violence against Native women and children
→Appoint Native Americans to my Administration

Native Americans were here first. 

Our nation has failed to fulfill our obligations to Tribal Nations. Today, I released a plan that will honor tribal sovereignty and invest in Native American communities.

My Children’s Agenda will:

Ensure our children have access to health care and high-quality education
Stop the treatment of children as adults in the criminal justice system
Cut child poverty by at least 50% in my first term
I believe in America with health care for all, where teachers are paid their value, where being Black in your own home isn’t a death sentence. Together, we can make that America a reality.

The United States has signed over 500 treaties with Tribal Nations—and we have broken every single one of them.

Because of our actions, Native American communities lag behind others in terms of health care, education, and economic development. Together, we can right this.https://twitter.com/tperry518/status/1186260709702848513 …

→Appoint Native Americans to my Administration

As president, here's my plan for LGBTQ+ Americans:

Establish a Chief Advocate for LGBTQ+ Affairs in the White House
Sign the Equality Act into law
Reverse the ban on trans service members
Make PrEP affordable and accessible

Trump & Pence have done nothing but promote discrimination against the LGBTQ+ community. From arguing in court that federal civil rights law doesn’t protect gay workers, to banning transgender service members—it’s time the LGBTQ+ community had a fighter again in the White House.

Representation matters—and it’s important that we invest in and lift up those whose voices are not heard. That’s why, as president, I will establish a transgender fellowship to elevate promising young leaders in the transgender community.

As president, I will appoint LGBTQ+ people—including transgender and gender non-conforming people—to leadership roles throughout my Administration because our government and our courts work best when they reflect the people they serve.https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kamala-harris-vows-to-include-lgbtq-people-in-cabinet-and-other-top-posts/ …
